text:
'Cangjie programming language_operators_operators_overview': 'In Cangjie code language, The following table lists all the operators supported by Cangjie, along with their precedence and associativity. The lower the number in the precedence column, the higher the precedence of the operator.
Operator	Priority	Meaning	Example	Association direction
@	0	Macro call	@id	Right-associative
.	1	Member access	expr.id	Left-associative
[]	1	Index	expr[expr]	Left-associative
()	1	Function call	expr(expr)	 Left-associative
++	2	Increment	var++  ++var	None
--	2	 Decrement	var--  --var	None
?	2	 Question mark	expr?.id, expr?[expr], expr?(expr), expr?{expr}	None
!	3	Bitwise NOT, Logical NOT	!expr	Right-associative
-	3	Unary Negative	-expr	Right-associative
**	4	Exponentiation	expr ** expr	Right-associative
*, /	5	Multiplication, Division	expr * expr, expr / expr	Left-associative
%	5	Modulus	expr % expr	Left-associative
+, -	6	Addition, Subtraction	expr + expr, expr - expr	Left-associative
<<	7	Bitwise left shift	expr << expr	Left-associative
>>	7	Bitwise right shift	expr >> expr	Left-associative
..	8	Range operator	expr..expr		None
..=	8	Range operator with step	expr..=expr	None
<	9	Less than	expr < expr  Translation: expr < expr	None
<=	9	Less than or equal to	expr <= expr	None
>	9	>	expr > expr	None
>=	9	Greater than or equal	expr >= expr	None
is	9	Type checking	expr is Type	None
as	9	Type Conversion	expr as Type	None
==	10	Equality Check	expr == expr	None
!=	10	Check inequality	expr != expr	None
&	11	Bitwise AND	expr & expr	Left-associative
^	12	Bitwise XOR	expr ^ expr	Left-associative
|	13	Bitwise OR	expr | expr	Left-associative
&&	14	Logical OR	expr && expr	Left-associative
||	15	Logical OR	expr || expr	Left-associative
??	16	Coalescing operator	expr ?? expr	Right-associative
|>	17	pipeline operator	id |> expr		Left-associative
~>  >>	17	Composition operator	expr ~> expr	Left-associative
=	18	Assignment	id = expr	None
**=	18	Compound operators	id **= expr	None
*=	18	Compound operators	id *= expr		None
/=	18	Compound assignment operators	id /= expr		None
%=	18	Compound assignment operators	id %= expr	None
+=	18	Compound assignment operator	id += expr	None
-=	18	Compound assignment operators	id -= expr		None
<<=	18	Compound assignment operators	id <<= expr	None
>>=	18	Compound assignment operators	id >>= expr	None
&=	18	Compound assignment operators	id &= expr	None
^=	18	Compound assignment operators	id ^= expr	None
|=	18	Compound assignment operators	id |= expr		None
&&=	18	Compound assignment operators	id &&= expr	None
||=	18	Compound assignment operators	id ||= expr  id |== expr	None'

'Cangjie programming language_operators_operator_functions_overview': 'In Cangjie code language, The following table lists the operator functions supported by Cangjie, along with their function signatures and examples.
Operator functions	Function Signature	Example
[] (Index Access)	operator func [](index1: T1, index2: T2, ...): R	this[index1, index2, ...]
[] (Index Assignment)	operator func [](index1: T1, index2: T2, ..., value!: TN): R	this[index1, index2, ...] = value
()	operator func ()(param1: T1, param2: T2, ...): R	this(param1, param2, ...)
!	operator func !(): R	!this
**	operator func **(other: T): R	this ** other
*	operator func *(other: T): R	this * other
/	operator func /(other: T): R	this / other
%	operator func %(other: T): R	this % other
+	operator func +(other: T): R	this + other
-	operator func -(other: T): R	this - other
<<	operator func <<(other: T): R	this << other
>>	operator func >>(other: T): R	this >> other
<	operator func <(other: T): R	this < other
<=	operator func <=(other: T): R	this <= other
>	operator func >(other: T): R	this > other
>=	operator func >=(other: T): R	this >= other
==	operator func ==(other: T): R	this == other
!=	operator func !=(other: T): R	this != other
&	operator func &(other: T): R	this & other
^	operator func ^(other: T): R	this ^ other
|	operator func |(other: T): R	this | other'
